f_44096432.name: Amalfi White and Gray Outdoor Sofa by Studio 63 in Stainless Steel

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: An elegant design where to enjoy long-lasting comfort while sipping a drink in good company or simply admiring a blooming garden, this sofa is a modern outdoor furniture piece marked by sinuous curves. The harmonious stainless steel frame, powder-varnished in manganese gray, is coupled to a plump cushioned seat covered in white Sunbrella Nattè fabric. Protective covers are included.

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: "Sintra bench" Designed by Project 213A in 2023 The bench is made by highly skilled craftsmen in Northern Portugal from oak wood. This bench is part of the "Sintra" collection which also features a curved bench and a dining table and with their characteristic playful curved legs. Bespoke dimensions and wood options available upon request. Production lead time: 6-8 weeks Rates vary by destination and complexity. Customs Duties & Taxes May Apply Ships from: Portugal   Returns Project 213A can only accept returns for in stock furniture, all furniture made on request and items returned without original packaging are non-refundable. Please note that delivery charges will not be refunded and that all costs for return shipment will be covered by the customer.

f_27438162.name: Modern Curved Serpentine Sofa in Orange Velvet W Gold & Wood Details

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: Modern curved serpentine sofa in orange velvet w gold & wood details Giulia sofa is a modern mid-century style sofa. This luxury sofa promises to be the absolute protagonist of a modern living room project. Its mid-century style inspiration is reflected in its shapes, revealing an eclectic and luxurious lifestyle. Materials: upholstered in velvet; legs in polished brass. Dimensions: width: 320 cm 126,0 in – depth: 180 cm 70,9 in – height: 80 cm 31,5 in – seat height: 43 cm 16,9 in. About Hommés: HOMMÉS was born from a skilled merge of visionary identities, with distinctive perspectives of design, art, fashion, and cultures. Our brand's life motto is introducing an Haute Couture concept in the Interior Design industry. Introducing a nouveau Haute Couture Interiors concept, presenting spaces with bold and unique identities. We have focused on the in-depth study of different interior trends throughout the 20th and the 21st century, paying particular attention to how they can fit contemporary spaces. We craft our own identity with precision, challenging the interior's boundaries to the limit with that purpose in mind. Our design pieces are a tribute to craftsmanship, honoring the art of creating soulful products with handmade techniques.

f_44096362.name: Amalfi White and Gray Outdoor Chaise Longue by Studio 63 in Stainless Steel

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: This sublime chaise longue was conceived having in mind the chance of laying on a plush design while observing an Amalfi sunset from a coastal terrace. Fine Sunbrella Nattè white fabric covers the entire L-shaped cushioned seat, which is set on a sturdy stainless steel frame powder-varnished in manganese gray and outlined by captivatingly sinuous curves. Protective covers are included.

f_32312692.name: Lounge Sofa in Cognac Leather by George Bighinello for Eurosalotto, Italy, 1970s

condition.details: Wear consistent with age and use.

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: Large lounge sofa in cognac leather by George Bighinello for Eurosalotto, Italy, in the 1970s. A large lounge sofa in cognac leather by George Bighinello for Eurosalotto., Italy, in the 1970s. A large, fluffy, stylish lounge sofas that feature round lines and shapes invite you to take a seat and relax—designed by George Bighinello for Eurosalotto Italy in the 1970s. Generously proportioned leather lounge sofa. Extremely comfortable, chic, and highly indicative of the Italian 1970's glamorous design period. This comfy lounge sofa would make an eye-catching addition to any interior, such as a living room, family room, screening room, or office. It also perfectly fits in a hospitality or corporate location like a boutique hotel lobby, cocktail bar, members club, or luxury boutique. In excellent vintage condition, with a minor patina on the leather.

f_44103332.name: Djinn Chaise Lounge Attributed to Olivier Mourgue for Airborne, France, 1960s

condition.details: Reupholstered. Wear consistent with age and use.

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: This 'Djinn' chaise longue by Olivier Mourgue for Airborne International is stunning. It was produced in France between 1964 and 1965. This chaise longue is well known for its appearance in "2001: A Space Odyssey" by Stanley Kubrick and is part of Center de Pompidou and the New York's MoMA collection. This epic piece of modernism from the Mid-20th Century is as beautiful as it is comfortable and will surely become a favourite piece of furniture in your living room. Condition: Excellent, Reupholstered, Completely restored, This Djinn chaise longue has new stripes, foam and luxurious curly boucle on a tubular steel frame. At the customer's special request, AMS Gallery offers a re-upholstery service in a fabric of choice. We guarantee the originality and authenticity of each of our items. The process of renovation and reupholstering is performed by experienced craftsmen with great attention to originality. Our team makes sure that each element retains its value and is ready for many years. Dimensions: Width: 175 cm / 68.9 in. Depth: 60 cm / 23.63 in. Height: 63 cm / 24.81 in. About the Designer: Olivier Mourgue (French, born 1939) is a French artist and industrial designer. Best known for his design of the Djinn line of furniture, Mourgue’s aesthetic is characterized by brightly colored jersey fabric stretched over structural steel frames that are filled with polyether foam, creating a unified, futuristic, alien-like modular form. Born in Paris, France in 1939, he began his career with an innovative design for a chaise lounge in 1964, after which he expanded his original furniture line to include loveseats, stools, and anthropomorphic chairs. Despite also producing paintings and drawings, his career was ultimately dedicated to industrial design, and provided a quintessential aesthetic of 1960s Modernist furniture. His influence is noted by his work’s inclusion in popular culture landmarks such as Stanley Kubrik’s 1968 film, 2001: A Space Odyssey. Shipping: These armchairs will be packaged and shipped with the greatest care and attention to make sure you will receive the items in gallery condition.
specifications.rawSpecificationsText:
This 'Djinn' chaise longue by Olivier Mourgue for Airborne International is stunning.

It was produced in France between 1964 and 1965.

This chaise longue is well known for its appearance in "2001: A Space Odyssey" by Stanley Kubrick and is part of Center de Pompidou and the New York's MoMA collection.

This epic piece of modernism from the Mid-20th Century is as beautiful as it is comfortable and will surely become a favourite piece of furniture in your living room.
Condition:
Excellent, Reupholstered, Completely restored, This Djinn chaise longue has new stripes, foam and luxurious curly boucle on a tubular steel frame.
At the customer's special request, AMS Gallery offers a re-upholstery service in a fabric of choice. We guarantee the originality and authenticity of each of our items. The process of renovation and reupholstering is performed by experienced craftsmen with great attention to originality. Our team makes sure that each element retains its value and is ready for many years.

Dimensions:
Width: 175 cm / 68.9 in.
Depth: 60 cm / 23.63 in.
Height: 63 cm / 24.81 in.

 

About the Designer:

Olivier Mourgue (French, born 1939) is a French artist and industrial designer. Best known for his design of the Djinn line of furniture, Mourgue’s aesthetic is characterized by brightly colored jersey fabric stretched over structural steel frames that are filled with polyether foam, creating a unified, futuristic, alien-like modular form. Born in Paris, France in 1939, he began his career with an innovative design for a chaise lounge in 1964, after which he expanded his original furniture line to include loveseats, stools, and anthropomorphic chairs. Despite also producing paintings and drawings, his career was ultimately dedicated to industrial design, and provided a quintessential aesthetic of 1960s Modernist furniture. His influence is noted by his work’s inclusion in popular culture landmarks such as Stanley Kubrik’s 1968 film, 2001: A Space Odyssey. 

Shipping:
These armchairs will be packaged and shipped with the greatest care and attention to make sure you will receive the items in gallery condition.
